column1: Les Pavillons-sous-Bois is a commune in the eastern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 12.8 km (8.0 mi) from the center of Paris.

column1: The commune of Les Pavillons-sous-Bois was created on 3 January 1905 by detaching its territory from the commune of Bondy but the first traces of activity on its territory are found around the 17th century. The name of the commune literally means "the lodges under wood". The lodges mentioned in the name are two guard lodges
column2: built of local stone around 1770 and rehabilitated in 1998
column3: that were located at the entrance of the estate belonging to the château du Raincy. The wood mentioned in the name is the ancient Bondy Forest which covered most of the area to the northeast of Paris.

column1: Les Pavillons-sous-Bois is served by no station of the Paris Métro or RER
column2: but since 2006 its own Tram station on line
column3: Les Pavillons-sous-bois. The closest RER station to Les Pavillons-sous-Bois is Le Raincy – Villemomble – Montfermeil station on Paris RER line . This station is located in the neighboring commune of Le Raincy
column4: 3.2 km (2.0 mi) from the centre of Les Pavillons-sous-Bois.

column1: The city shows various aspects. The Canal of Ourcq
column2: channel built by Napoleon III to bring more water to Paris
column3: and the national road RN3 constitute since the creation of the city a double line of parting between the south zone
column4: dedicated to traditional habitat (mainly houses with gardens) and urban activities
column8: nowadays in a rehabilitation process including new habitation areas
column9: sports and leisure areas along the channel and new public service buildings.

column1: One special primary school (primaire d'application): École Jules Verne
Public junior high schools: Collège Anatole France and Collège Eric Tabarly
Public senior high schools: Lycée Professionnel Nicolas Ledoux
A private elementary-junior high school: Ecole-Collège privé de l'Alliance
